title: Pistons - Disassembly

body.body: Make sure that the engine is securely mounted in an engine stand or properly supported when it is removed from the motorcycle.
If the engine is not correctly supported, it can fall.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in damage to property or serious injury.
It is not necessary to remove the connecting rods from the crankshaft.
Remove and discard the gudgeon pin circlip from one side of the piston.
Push the gudgeon pin through the piston and rod toward the side from which the circlip was removed.
Never force the gudgeon pin through the piston. This may cause damage to the piston which may also damage the liner when assembled.
If you find the gudgeon pin is tight in the piston, check the piston for a witness mark caused by the circlip. Carefully remove the mark to allow the pin to be removed.
Piston rings must be removed from the piston using hand pressure only. Do not overextend the piston rings during removal.
If the piston rings are to be reused, note the orientation of the oil control rings before removal.
